title: "Every year you work is a failure":  Watch this NBA star shut down a smug reporter with a valuable lesson on losing
description:
I caught this clip of Milwaukee Bucks star Giannis Antetokounmpo I wanted to share. It's a similar conversation I have with my niece when a game doesn't go her way. Plus as conservatives, seeing any reporter get it thrown back in their face for any reason whatsoever gives us the warm fuzzies.

Though I cop to not knowing much about the NBA other than a) Giannis is really good, b) he's Greek (shout out Pantellis), and c) I'm supposed to fear the deer. The Bucks got knocked out of the playoffs. A reporter asked Giannis if it means they were failures.

Giannis is outstanding: “There’s no failure in sports. There’s good days, bad days, some days you are able to be successful, some days you are not, some days it is your turn, some days it’s not. That’s what sports is about. You don’t always win.” pic.twitter.com/aTnFpnGtdx
— Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) April 27, 2023
Do you get a promotion every year on your job? No, right? So every year you work is a failure, yes or no? No. Every year you work, you work towards something, towards a goal, right, which is to get a promotion, to be able to take care of your family. Provide a house for them or take care of your parents.

Exactly. You are either winning or you're learning. I got that from MMA coach Duke Rufous. He's out of Wisconsin too. It must be something in the cheese.

You lose a competition, sure. It's a competition. There can be only one winner, and if you aren't playing to win there's no point. But sometimes you're in the locker room next to the one they're spraying champagne on each other in.

What you do next is what matters.

There’s no failure in sports. You know, there are good days and bad days. Some days you are able to be successful, sometimes you’re not. Some days it’s your turn, some days it’s not your turn. ... We’re going to come back next year, try to be better, try to build good habits, try to play better, not have a ten-day stretch with playing bad basketball, you know, and hopefully we can win a championship.

A valuable lesson everyone from all walks of life can stand to remember.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: Tucker Carlson is the target of a shakedown, but by who?
description:
Crowder closed out the week by exposing the shakedown of Tucker Carlson. Crowder set the scene by breaking down Tucker's comeback video from last night. Crowder explained what some of the things Carlson said in this video actually mean - notably, that Tucker hinted at censorship going on at places like Fox, and that he might be aware of some unflattering texts or emails of his that could leak soon. This is what leads to the "shakedown".

Crowder then got to some of the new information that has come to light, namely, the lawsuit against Tucker filed by his former booking producer. This lawsuit will likely lead to discovery and reveal texts, emails, etc. that will be taken out of context and used against him. Mainstream media is already reporting on "crude" text messages of his, as well as "vulgarities" he allegedly used to describe women and anti-semitic jokes.

Oh, and the booking producer suing him has actually never met him. Small detail.

\u201cAbby Grossberg NEVER met Tucker.\u201d
— Steven Crowder (@Steven Crowder) 1682607827

The broad suing him appeared on MSNBC and said Tucker and his Executive Producer were responsible for "breaking" her and making her life "a living hell". Remember, never once met him.

Crowder pointed out how if Tucker had done something truly terrible, we would know about it. These vague descriptions of his alleged infractions hint that they don't actually have anything on him. Fox News also apparently has a "dossier" of dirt on Tucker that they are prepared to release if he goes after the network. Crowder pointed out that they are reporting this preemptively, so if Tucker tries to defend himself, they'll claim he attacked them first. And for years to come, these allegations against Tucker will be the first thing to come up in Google search results.

There was a lot more on this topic, as well as a segment on a new "queer" western film. So be sure to catch the whole show over on Rumble.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: Al Sharpton Demands Answers Over CNN's Firing Of Don Lemon, Says He's 'Completely Stunned'
description:
In case you forgot, Don Lemon was let go by CNN this week. No one really cares, because the story was buried by the arguably much more important departure of Tucker Carlson from Fox News. But one person really, really cares: Al Sharpton. And he wants answers.

In a joint statement with Marc Morial, the president and CEO of the National Urban League, Sharpton said: "We are completely stunned at the termination of Don Lemon. Throughout his career, Don has been a superb journalist who was very open to the civil rights community on issues others wouldn’t touch… With the health of our democracy undergoing perhaps its greatest test, we cannot afford to silence his voice.”

Of course it's about "dEmOcRaCy". What else.

“We would like to know what he alludes to when he said there are greater things at play, which is why we urge for a full explanation as to why he was let go in such a fashion."

\u201cRev. Al Sharpton demands answers from CNN over Don Lemon firing https://t.co/wGXNFqS6B8\u201d
— New York Post (@New York Post) 1682563699

In his tweet announcing his firing, Lemon said: “It is clear that there are some larger issues at play.” My guess is those "larger issues" are actually something quite simple, like, he's too partisan, and CEO Chris Licht is trying to make the network less partisan. Or perhaps it's even more simple- they don't like him.

Licht released a very tasteful statement on his firing: "CNN and Don have parted ways. Don will forever be part of the CNN family, and we thank him for his contributions over the past 17 years. We wish him well and will be cheering him on in his future endeavors.”

It could have had something to do with Lemon's comments over women, most notably the now infamous "past her prime jab at Nikki Haley. Some rumors claim it was related to Lemon's spar with Vivek Ramaswamy over gun rights and the Civil War. Whatever it is, Al Sharpton will get to the bottom of it. Maybe.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

description:
Tucker Carlson put out a video on his Twitter last night and it went viral. We’ll give you the latest as well as new information. Also, Zelensky holds the first war phone call with Xi Jinping. And an obese woman calls for a hot fat girl summer. Guest: Bryan Callen.

TUCKER’S FIRST STATEMENT

  • Tucker Carlson departs Fox News, pushed out by Rupert Murdoch
  • In Lawsuit, Tucker Carlson Accused of Promoting Hostile Work Environment
  • Abby Grossberg: Tucker Carlson made 'my life a living hell'
  • Confirmed: ex-Tucker Carlson producer suing Tucker Carlson has never met Tucker Carlson
  • Confirmed: ex-Tucker Carlson producer suing Tucker Carlson has never met Tucker Carlson

PEDRO PASCAL’S QUEER WESTERN

  • Pedro Pascal and Ethan Hawke star in the first trailer for Pedro Almodóvar’s queer western ‘STRANGE WAY OF LIFE’.
  • Pedro Almodóvar is making his 'answer to Brokeback Mountain' with Ethan Hawke, Pedro Pascal
  • Pedro Pascal and Ethan Hawke Lead Steamy Romance in Trailer for 'Strange Way of Life'

XI CALLS ZELENSKY

  • Ukraine's Zelensky holds first war phone call with China's Xi
  • @ZelenskyyUa
  • Chinese President Xi holds phone talks with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy
  • All Nato members have agreed Ukraine will eventually join, says Stoltenberg
  • Chinese-Brokered Deal Upends Mideast Diplomacy and Challenges U.S.
  • WAR UPDATE: Zelensky initiated a call to Xi
  • Congress Approved $113 Billion of Aid to Ukraine in 2022
  • Russia says China agreed to secretly provide weapons, leaked documents show
  • Ukraine says it is finding more Chinese components in Russian weapons
  • China's March imports of Russian oil may hit record - shiptracking data
  • "So now we're on a trajectory to be the leading backer of an ongoing attritional war in Europe..."

ESG IN BANKING

  • BlackRock CEO Larry Fink explaining how they use stock ownership to control the world’s largest corporations.
  • BlackRock Assets Exceed $9 Trillion in Wake of Bank Failures
  • Biden Ties to BlackRock Deepen With Latest Treasury Hire
  • Our fiduciary approach to sustainability and the low-carbon transition
  • BlackRock’s tyrannical ESG agenda
  • BlackRock’s Pitch for Socially Conscious Investing Antagonizes All Sides
  • A Bank President Who Embraces the Unconventional
  • Where ESG's $35 Trillion Explosion Really Came From
  • Robert Schwartz, 88, Broker and Promoter of Social Causes, Dies
  • Credit card companies reject specialized code to track large sales of firearms and ammo
  • How Amalgamated Bank Takes a Stand on Reproductive Rights
  • Amalgamated Bank
  • Can embracing ESG be bad for business?
  • DO Black - the world’s first credit card with a carbon limit
  • How ESG-Linked Loans Help to Hold Firms Accountable
  • With 20% of Retail Banks Planning to Significantly Increase Spending on ESG, Sustainability Is the Next Frontier for Competitive Advantage

title: WATCH: Therapist Told Trans Teacher Who Allegedly Threatened School Shooting 'Therapy Is Not Gonna Work'
description:
A few weeks ago, a middle school in Florida didn't notify parents after a trans teacher allegedly threatened to shoot up the school. Which is a wee bit of a problem.

Moms For Liberty obtained the dash cam footage of police arriving at the home of Alexander Renczkowski (the trans teacher) after the alleged threats were made and Renczkowski said he was having “bad thoughts”. A deputy collected three firearms and ammo from his house under a temporary Risk Protection Order [RPO].

In the footage, the officer asks Renczkowski about a therapy appointment on the coming Monday. Renczkowski said it was with a new therapist, since his first one "was not that good, told me [Renczkwoski] ‘therapy is not gonna work for you.'”

So that's always good.

\u201c#BreakingNews - Check out this snippet of video from a HCSO Bodycam where #FoxChapel trans-teacher admits to a deputy...\n\n"My previous therapist said that therapy would not work for me"\n\nWow!\n\nThe @HernandoSchools kept this person around children for 3 weeks after threats were\u2026\u201d
— Monty Floyd (@Monty Floyd) 1682483410

Parents didn't find out about the threats on their children's lives until the story hit local news. Parents also told Daily Caller they received no information or help from the school after they inquired about the threat.

Monty Floyd of Moms for Liberty told Daily Caller, "This new footage is very troubling, and together with the RPO they bring a lot of serious questions. The prior coverup, the mishandling of this incident and the continued efforts of the school board and union to bury this, intimidate parents, and flat out lie to the public has all but wiped out public trust among a majority of parents in our school district.”

On the bright side, the teacher has since been removed from the classroom after the superintendent promised concerned parents they would look into how the threat was handled. On the not so bright side, the school had originally allowed the teacher to return to the classroom without notifying the parents about anything that was going on.

Home schooling is looking better and better each day.

>

<

Lily is a Zoomer college dropout who somehow landed a writing gig here at LwC.com. In her spare time, she enjoys going for runs, touching grass, and occasionally tweeting tweets for fellow tweeters.

title: Watch: Man shares unbelievable story how Buffy the Vampire Slayer saved his family and neighbors from a tornado
description:
As someone who, unfortunately, finds himself in the Oprhan's Club, it's very important to make sure your parents share their stories. This kid did, and we got an amazing piece of content. It's about the time his father and Buffy the Vampire Slayer teamed up to save the entire block from a tornado.

Picture it: 2003. Evanescence ruled the airwaves. A young George W. Bush made us laugh with the way he said "nuclear" and "strategy." And Sarah Michelle Gellar was leading the Scooby Gang in one last adventure in the Buffy series finale. The Buffy "Scoopy Gang." Gellar also starred in the Scooby Doo movies.

This man loved the show so much, he was willing to be wiped out by a tornado in order to watch the finale.

This is awesome. pic.twitter.com/2ggQ4dvIUI
— Jason Twin-Pilled 🥞🍺🏴 (@twinpilled) April 24, 2023

First off, shout out to my man (do you wanna get) rocking the Def Leppard shirt. The Adrenalize Tour was the first concert I ever went to on my own.

The story as told by our bearded friend is as follows. It was the series finale of Buffy the Vampire Slayer when the tornado sirens went off. His wife panicked and rounded up all the kids and neighbors to go in the storm cellar. Our narrator wasn't having it. He has been invested in this show for seven years. He was going to see it through.

If the tornado got him? Meh, he had a good run.

After two or three hours later, after Angel goes off and all that bullsh*t...

...I'm looking for y'all and y'all were nowhere around. So I go back and hear y'all in the storm cellar screaming for someone to let you out. And that big old oak tree had fallen over on top of the door and trapped you all inside. So if I was inside the f*cking cellar with y'all, we'd all be dead.

"In that f*cking cellar." "Sarah Michelle Gellar." Whoa!

Television saved the day. Television, and I'm sure a little laziness. Beat THAT with one of your dad's stories!

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Randi Weingarten tries rewriting history of her teachers' union thuggery during pandemic, gets DESTROYED by fact-checkers
description:
Leftists are attempting "The Great Backtrack." People like Justin Trudeau, Anthony Fauci (who was awarded a Presidential Commendation by Donald Trump), and others want you to forget all the freedoms they took away from you, all the mandates, and all the "public health orders" they forced on you that were WORSE for your health. But few people can choke on a bag of dicks more than teachers' union mob boss Randi Weingarten.

The teachers' unions colluded with the CDC to keep schools closed. They were busted rewriting the guidelines that kept your kids in masks. Masks, mind you, that Weingarten KNEW impeded learning. And yesterday at senate hearing, she attempted to say "Nuh-uh."

AFT President Randi Weingarten: "We spent every day from February on trying to get schools open. We knew that remote education was not a substitute for opening schools." pic.twitter.com/1qNL05VD3u
— Washington Free Beacon (@FreeBeacon) April 26, 2023

So while union boss Randi was all like "we spent every day from February on trying to get schools open," Twitter's Community Notes was all like "that f*ck you did."

During the pandemic Randi, her union goons, and the Democrat politicians she gives millions and millions of dollars to:

  • Called attempts to reopen schools in the fall of 2020 "Reckless, callous, cruel"
  • Pushed aggressively at the local level to keep schools closed
  • Areas with high union influence -- aka, areas run by Democrats -- remained closed much longer
  • The school closings continued well in 2022

And while we've discussed it before (this isn't the first time Randi has attempted to gaslight America), to have everything in one place you should make sure to bookmark these two Twitter threads:

New York Times, July 24th, 2020.https://t.co/APMEFO0nBF pic.twitter.com/UNkOSIjKxU
— Stephen L. Miller (@redsteeze) September 1, 2022


2) Biden's @WHCommsDir Kate Bedingfield, Feb. 9, 2021, refusing to commit to re-opening schools: Biden's "listening to the science" pic.twitter.com/6dGtuFqox6
— Tom Elliott (@tomselliott) September 1, 2022

The left is going to do anything they can to lie, gaslight, and convince YOU that they aren't to blame for the suffering that went on during the pandemic. And they will do so with the full support of legacy media. Legacy media that, while you were struggling to make ends meet and make sure your kids didn't fall behind, never missed a paycheck.

There is nothing more important for you as an American to do than to make sure they NEVER get away with this.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.

title: Watch: Tucker Carlson broadcasts for first time since firing, sends strong hint on what his future plans are
description:
Tucker Carlson broadcast for the first time since getting fired from Fox News last night. He released a video on Twitter. Yes, at 8:00 PM eastern. Because why break with tradition?

Call me crazy, but I think our man lets us know what his future plans are:

Good evening pic.twitter.com/SPrsYKWKCE
— Tucker Carlson (@TuckerCarlson) April 27, 2023
One of the first things you realize when you step outside the noise for a few days is how many genuinely nice people there are in this country, kind and decent people, people who really care about what’s true and a bunch of hilarious people — also, a lot of those.

Hell yeah to that, brother. It's why on Twitter we ask how you plan to enjoy a politics-free weekend. We ALL need a break outside of the noise. Noise that will still be there on Monday after we take a few days to watch little league, do a project around the house, day drink, etc.

Where Tucker sends the signal as to what his future holds is his revelation about how stupid cable news is.

This is the amazing thing, the undeniably big topics, the ones that will define our future, get virtually no discussion at all: war, civil liberties, emerging science, demographic change, corporate power, natural resources. When was the last time you heard a legitimate debate about any of those issues? It’s been a long time. Debates like that are not permitted in American media. Both political parties and their donors have reached consensus on what benefits them, and they actively collude to shut down any conversation about it.

It's everything Crowder has been preaching since the beginning of MugClub. It's why Joe Rogan's podcast has become so popular. You can only cover these stories or get to the bottom of these issues in a longform format. One where you aren't dependent on corporate sponsors. You can't have a rational discussion about important issues on cable news, let alone a debate.

For starters, the majority of employees at media networks don't hide their loathing towards any non-radical left viewpoint. Turns out, that includes Fox News. But also, you can't discuss issues in eight-minute segments between commercial breaks where three or more people have time for two talking points and MAYBE a snarky quip.

Tucker sounds like going to go the Megyn Kelly/Steven Crowder/James O'Keefe route. He's going to go into business for himself. Cover the stories HE finds important and the debates on the big issues that aren't discussed on cable news. Ones that matter to the American people.

I'll give you hint: unless you are driving around in your truck with banners flying or standing on the street corner holding up signs, you don't care about the minute-by-minute whereabouts of Donald Trump as much as CNN does.

What people DO care about? War, civil liberties, emerging science, demographic change, corporate power, natural resources, ad how all of these things affect supporting your family.

As I said yesterday and to again paraphrase Segio from Get Him to the Greek, Tucker gonna be fine. Fuck a Murdoch.

>

<

Brodigan is Grand Poobah of this here website and when he isn't writing words about things enjoys day drinking, pro-wrestling, and country music. You can find him on the Twitter too.
